The Johns Hopkins website has much more current data about Canada, which is disconcerting. Otherwise it's nothing but advice to stay home and wash your hands. Good advice, but no data = not useful. Edit: Kept it on my phone in case it became more useful. It didn't. Have now deleted it.

The symptom tracker needs some improvement. I have moderate to severe asthma so I regularly have symptoms like difficulty breathing & coughing. I also have seasonal allergies so sneezing & sinus issues are common for me right now too. If I check these things off on the symptom tracker, it automatically assumes the worst even tho I don't have any other common symptoms like fever, haven't traveled, or been in close contact with know Covid cases. The app doen't ask about pre existing conditions.

Very well organized and concise information. Easy access to navigate, very well planned and executed. I would like to see "Total recovered" included in the "Canada situation numbers" to make it a complete report.

App provides important information and has graphs that provide information at a glance. However, there is no mechanism to exit the app. No exit item on a menu, does not honour a double-tap on back. Developer needs to provide an exit mechanism. As important as the information is that is provide, it's no excuse for poor behaviour in an otherwise excellent app.
Great information and very detailed stats.

So very basic. The app refers you elsewhere for more up to date information!! The info on here should be live or at least as live as possible otherwise there is no point in having an app. There is no local geographic information to track the pandemic in your area - just your province and that is not up to date. Very disapointed.

Damn good solid app. No issues so far. (My device is a Pixel 2). Very informative, well laid out and easy to navigate. Just installed it April 1st/20 and I've been on this app at least 30 times. Thank you makers!!
Thanks for making this.

Rating 5 stars since open communication is key, and people are quibbling over what else they want in it. We don't need this experiencing the same downvote problems that homework apps experienced. If you want more info, visit the Health Canada site, if your device won't run it, visit the Health Canada site. If you want info not being provided, visit the Health Canada site. The app is here to push urgent information to us, stop lowballing the ratings.
This app is very well designed. I love all the drawings, makes you feels comfortable with the app.

Very well done. Clean and well designed UI, and operates smoothly. Information is well organized, it's very easy to find what you're looking for. Could maybe use a setting to adjust notification settings. Overall really pleased with this app.
Decent app. Small quibble, but could the statistics tab not just link to a website? I use the app for a more native experience. Thanks.

I think that it's important that every Canadian get this app so that they can keep up-to-date on the government recommendations as they will most likely be changing over the course of the coming days.
